Their body distantly resembled human, but it was weirdly changed. Their shoulders were wider, they didn't have legs at all, their head looked like alien's and they didn't have neck. You can believe it or not, but I think that it might be true. The Zone is constantly changing - mutants are changing too. So I think I'll believe that old man.

I heard that stalkers found a weird incubators that contained even weirder looking embryos. When veteran stalker saw them, he said that those embryos looked like newborn poltergeists. Were they grown in there?
Some people believe that poltergeists are souls of stalkers that died from emissions. But I don't believe such stuff.

I heard that poltergeists were "unstable" before. They would suddenly change into their physical form for a short period, becoming more vulnerable. It seems that they mutated to become more stable like they are now. But some stalkers say that those are "newborn" poltergeists that haven't learn how to sustain their intangible form yet. Who knows...

I heard that there's a type of poltergeists that can become completely invisible. They are floating in the air too, but they're not throwing any items. Instead, they would fly at you and hit you. The only way to see them would be by barely noticeable distortion in the air and their quiet mumbling. Also you can use detector to see them on the screen. I don't know where do they live, but I haven't met one yet.

I heard a very creepy thing. Stalkers were exploring an underground somewhere deep in the Zone. They met an unusually powerful poltergeist there. It not only threw things at them, but also created fire pillars, just like pyrogeists do, and it also struck them with lightning bolts. Half of the squad was killed very fast. And it weren't the only things he could do. It could also create illusions. And when stalkers shot at those illusions, they would split into more. Stalkers were able to figure out which one of them was the real one and killed him. They have never returned to that underground again. And the knocking noise that the poltergeist was making still haunts them in their dreams.

A creepy story I've heard. Group of stalkers got a SOS signal. They arrived at the spot and saw an abandoned factory. They carefully entered it and saw a bunch of corpses and a dead poltergeist. They looked around to find the survivor. One of the stalkers approaches mutant's body to get his trophy. Suddenly - the polter fucking punches him! Stalker fell down and didn't get up anymore. Averyone panicked, while the poltergeists began to crawl towards them. Their heads started to hurt while the items on the ground began to fly towards them. And not just items - poltergeist even threw bodies at them. Stalkers opened fire and killed the mutant before he would kill them all. Though, they still lost one more guy - polter hit his head with a wooden box. So... be careful when you decide to check the SOS signal location...

There's a rare mutant called «illusionist». It's a humanoid mutant that is very thin, his head is big and ugly, and it's so heavy that it hangs down onto his chest. And because of that, many stalkers think that the top of his head is his face. The mutant wears an old black coat. And this mutant will attack only in defence. It's ration is mushrooms juice and carrion. And the name comes from it's ability to create scary illusions if someone gets too close to it's lair.

Have you ever heard how dutyers were hunting a rare mutant for the ecologists? Well, the rare mutant, called «illusionist», set it's lair inside an abandoned factory, maybe it was «Rostok», I don't know. Eggheads wanted samples of this mutant for their research so they hired a Duty squad. Dutyers gathered their things and went to the factory. People say that the shooting was so loud that no one could sleep. And when everything went silent, the survived dutyers left the factory in hurry. Some of them were dragging mutant's body on a tarp, while others were carrying their dead comrades. When stalkers inspected the factory later, it looked like a battle field. Wreckage lying around, part of the roof fell. Piles of bullet casings laying around like in a shooting range. Blood, pieces of flesh everywhere. A bloody mess. I doubt that the job was worth it. Dutyers lost many good guys then.

Can you imagine - some stalkers were able to tame a mutant! I heard about three such cases. Once, soldiers at the Cordon tamed a blind dog, they called him Bobic. There's also one crazy stalker at Zaton that was able to tame a pseudodog, he called it Lassie. And, of course, I should bring the legendary Doctor and his pseudodog, tho I don't know how does he call it. How did they manage to find a common language with the beasts?

Have you heard about the legendary Doctor? I bet you've heard. Anyways, I heard that he tamed a pseudodog. But we know that pseudodogs originated from wolves, and Doctor's dog looks like a mutated bulldog. So maybe it's not a pseudodog after all...

I heard a story about one stalker that wanted to collect artefacts at Radar. But we all know how much radiation is there, and the stalker was short on money. Well, he took his «Sunrise» suit and modified it. He attached two air balloons to it's back and changed the inner material to increase psy-protection. He called his creation a «Hermosuit» and went on his journey to Radar. Some time later, stalkers found his body between the abandoned cars that was radioactive as fuck. So here's a moral of the story - don't try to make something yourself if your hands aren't good enough. Better to save up some money and buy yourself a good suit instead. Or else you'll end up just like him.

I heard a story that two soldiers once decided to steal couple of vests and sell them later. Well, they were able to stole two vests from the storage and hid them in the cellar. But two weeks later, someone sneaked into the block post during the night and stole bunch of things, including some important documents. And, of course, he also stole the two vests that were hidden. Commander ordered to recalculate their inventory to know what exactly is missing. And the thing is - the storage was locked for good, and our night thief wasn't able to get inside, but somehow they were two vests short. Commander started to shout at everyone and interrogate them one by one. Well, they found out who stole the vests, and those two soldiers got punished hard. Ye, funny story.

Did you know that anomalies can change items in some weird ways? For example, if a suit happens to fall into an anomaly without being turned into useless crap instantly, it may gain a very useful properties after some time. For example, stalkers found an unusual «Sunrise» suit inside the whirligig anomaly. This suit could repel bullets. No, it wouldn't save you if you'd get shot right in the chest, but if the bullet would fly towards your, let's say, arm, or shoulder, or kidney, it would get repelled. Stalkers named that suit «Enchanted Sunrise». Tho it's unclear how to throw a suit into an anomaly to get the needed effect.

Have you heard about the operation «Monolith»? The one where military were storming the CNPP after Strelok turned off the Brain Scorcher. I heard that the commander of the operation had an unusual armoured suit - a modified SKAT-9. The thing about that suit is that it uses the super-modern titan alloy, making the suit way lighter while keeping the same level of protection. Most likely, the suit is still laying near the CNPP.

Take my advice - do not trust Sidorovich. Yes, he's authoritative trader, but shit as a person. He sent many rookies in anomalies to get artefacts for him. Well, of course most rookies make it out alive, but still. He doesn't care about anything but money.

Be careful at the Cordon and any other place where helicopters are patrolling. Sometimes the pilot might get bored - then they'll start "clearing" the territory. Then it's better to hide somewhere and wait until the pilot gets tired of shooting anything that moves.

Did you know that Wolf had box of dynamite before? I don't know, why would he need it, but after some time that he got it, dutyers launched an attack at Freedom's base by blowing up one of the walls. Their attack, of course, failed, but something tells me that they got their dynamite from Wolf.

I heard a story from Wolf, that once a rookie got robbed by bandits somewhere at the Cordon, they also took his gun. That rookie was very angry for a while, then he somehow got himself an AK and ran to the ATP to get his revenge. The shooting started and ended in a couple of minutes. No one saw that rookie since then. Moral of the story - do not overestimate your powers, and don't seek stupid revenge.

You know that dutyers like to test those who wish to join them, right? I heard that there was a sergeant named Plichko, he liked to come up with weird tasks. Once, he ordered a rookie to get inside the abandoned hangar territory and check if there's any documentation left. The thing is, that hangar was full of «Burnt Fuzz», and the only way to entry was through the roof. Well, the rookie really wanted to be a Duty member, so he went on to do the job. Day has passed - he didn't return. Well, Plichko sent two dutyers to go and check what happened - maybe the stalker found something valuable and ran. Dutyers climbed on top of the hangar and saw large hole in it's roof. They look down - a piece of roof is laying on the ground, and stalker's body is hanging in the «Burnt Fuzz» with horror written on his face. Dutyers got terrified of such death, they reported the incident to the higher ranking officers. It wasn't the first time when Plichko sent a rookie to his death, so he lost his rank. And that is that.

Once a Freedom sniper started to shoot out the dutyers. He climbed on top of water tower not far away from bar «100 Rads» and shoot at every dutyer in sight. And every time someone closed in on him - he just disappeared. It was long before Duty moved their base closer to the bar. By doing that, sniper didn't let the dutyers that were sitting in the bar to return to their base. Dutyers hired an experienced stalker, he set an ambush on the sniper. It seems that freedomer didn't expect non-dutyer to kill him.

Have you ever heard of a guy named Borov, the one who was bandit's leader before? Well, someone killed him, and many thought that it was because of conflict between bandits, but I heard something more interesting. Some people say that it was Voronin who paid a stalker who was working for them to kill Borov. It all happened because bandits catched a dutyer who was carrying documents about X-18 laboratory back to the base. Hired stalker made his way into bandit base without raising any suspicion, killed Borov, took the documents and fled to the Duty base. Voronin gave him rank of Duty veteran for that. Some people even say that it was Strelok himself, but I doubt that things like that would interest him.

There was a sadistic bastard in Freedom ranks before, his name was Tyrant. They didn't kick him out because he was very skillful soldier. Once he was able to push his way into Wild Territory and capture the construction site with his squad. Dutyers spent a lot of time trying to kick him out of there, but they weren't successful. Then Voronin sent one experienced veteran to deal with it. And can you believe that - he sole handedly killed whole Tyrant's group, including him. After that Voronin promoted him to «Keeper of Duty» rank. Some people say that it was Strelok, but I don't believe that. Why would a loner help Duty?

One day, General Voronin, the leader of Duty, hired an experienced stalker to do a very important job - kill Lukash, the leader of Freedom. Stalker was meant to make his way into Freedom's base unnoticed, kill Lukash without making any noise and return with his PDA. But Freedomers aren't stupid - they know each other, and when they saw a freedomer that no one knew - they instantly realised what was going on. I don't know if the stalker ran away or died there - there's no information on that. But as we all know, Lukash is still alive and well.

In the past, Dutyers didn't let every stalker into Rostok Factory territory. They only let other dutyers pass, and those who had the permission. But... if there's a power, there's a corruption, right? Well, you could pass for one-two thousands of rubles, or if you would do something for them. For example, shoot mutant pack and bring the trophies. It's good that now you can pass freely. They really were acting more like bandits before.

Some time ago, there was a group of killer veterans camping in Wild Territory. They robbed and killed loners that were passing by. Right under Duty's nose! And Voronin just ignored it - the leader of that group, Lucky, was the one who helped Duty to capture territory of the factory. But Voronin knew that this shit can't go on, so he hired one stalkekr through Barkeep to deal with it, so that if he won't be successful, no one would know that it was Duty who hired him. Stalker attacked Lucky's group at night and killed them all. Dutyers don't like to talk about that story - and I'm not surprised, who would like to admit that they were friends with maniacs.

Once upon a time, a group of mercenaries under the command of Volkodav shot down a ecologists' helicopter that was returning from Yantar through the Wild Territory. Professor Kruglov was on that helicopter and he carried very important information. The helicopter fell down, but Kruglov and few peopel survived. Mercs surrounded them and were ready to shoot them all, when a stalker appeared from behind and killed every last of them. Can you imagine? They say that stalker was Strelok himself. I won't be surprised if it's true - he's not called that for nothing.

Did you know that mercenaries aren't the only one who tried to take information from the ecologists? I heard that freedomers once set an ambush on them at the Wild Territory. As far as I know, they weren't successful.

I heard that when bloodsuckers attack a group of stalkers, they like to leave one alive. They carry him together with the bodies back to their lair and wait. Many who get into that situation think that it's their chance to survive. They send SOS signal and when someone arrives - bloodsucker kills them. And then bloodsucker kills the "bait".

Have you ever heard of a stalker named Falcon? He was very a experienced loner and was searching for safe rout to the North. Once, he disappeared for six months, then appeared in Dark Valley. When stalkers found him, he was mumbling that he saw "it" and that "it" is now inside his head. He screamed that no one should go to the North. He talked about his daughter. Then he asked stalkers that found him to take the artefact he was holding and carry it to the Barkeep so that he would compensate something to his family. After stalkers took the artefact, Falcon suddenly ran straight into «Meatgrinder». Looks like Scorcher "burned" him after all. Sad story, he was a good stalker.

Dutyers have a weird habit to order the killing of their enemies from loners. For example, general Voronin once ordered Leshiy, the Freedom's guide. And what do we see today? Leshiy is alive and well. Not all loners are skilled. But dutyers can't hire mercs for that - they're at war with each other. Question - why won't they just send their own guy? That's because freedomer can feel a dutyer from a mile away.

Did you know, that Freedom's technician, Screw, was once a member of Duty? I don't know what led him to leave it, but some people say that Voronin hired a stalker to kill him after that. Well, as you may guess it, order wasn't fulfilled.

I heard that general Voronin once wanted to order a kill of Cap - freedomer that manages the protection of the Barrier. He thought that if they would get rid of freedomers at the Barrier, then monolithians and mutants would storm into Army Warehouses and destroy Freedom's base. Though it seems he didn't realise that if that would happen, it wouldn't be the end only for Freedom. Good thing that he was talked out of it.

Dutyers like to shift their job on other people's shoulders. For example, when they ordered kill of Max, who was managing the combat operation of Freedom, from some stalker. But Max knew that Duty wants his head - that's why he was always sitting right in the centre of Freedom's base. So obviously they weren't successful.

I heard that freedomers were planning on killing Plichko, security chief of Duty, to spread panic in Duty's ranks. It would allow them to infiltrate their own guys into enemy faction, but... Something went wrong and they didn't kill him.

Have you ever heard of a dutyer named Barin? He was greedy and cowardly bastard... He managed the food for Duty, all deals were made through him. Even dutyers didn't like him - he was so vile. Well, Lukash had his own reasons - so he ordered his death. Everything went smooth and clean, and no one in Duty even flinched - they would be happy to get rid of him themselves if they would have a good reason to do so. Someone was put in his place, so there were no problems from his death.

Have you ever heard of captain Ivantsov, the one who does the dirty work for Duty? I heard that he hanged a lot of freedomers. Freedom hates him so much, they even hired someone to kill him. Though they weren't successful - Ivantsov isn't weak.

Have you ever heard about attempted murder of colonel Petrenko? Once, a strange guy appeared in Bar, walked around. Then he went towards Duty territory, approached Petrenko when no one was around. People outside heard loud noise, they ran to the colonel and saw Petrenko holding this guy in tight grip and a knife laying nearby. They found out later that the guy was freedomer and he had a mission from Lukash to assassinate the colonel. He should've prepared better - Petrenko is a tough guy.

I heard that the other day dutyers caught a freedomer that tried to get into their territory undercover. He had explosive charge hid under his jacket and he was planning to plant it above the bunker where Voronin usually spends his day. Must admit, dutyers acted quick and coordinated when they caught this guy.

Did you know that ecologists aren't as innocent as they appear to be? I heard that they had an assistant that one day destroyed all information that was given to him and ran off. After some time a stalker appeared that matched his description, and what do you think Sakharov did? He put a price on his head! I don't know if the guy was killed or not, but after hearing that story I changed my opinion about those eggheads.

Barkeep told me a story about his first Zone days. He was young then and he entered the Zone with his friend. Together they explored many places, got in many situations. His friend really wanted to visit the centre of the Zone, he asked Barkeep to come with him. Barkeep declined and he was right about that decision. His friend went on alone... and disappeared. He later was seen as one of the Monolith soldiers. Such a sad story.

There was a stalker called Banana in Clear Sky. Don't ask me why did he get such a nickname, I don't know. He was a good guy. He felt so alive, so to speak. Cold was giving him hard missions and Banana always completed them. He had weird sense of fashion - he would take one suit and put on a helmet from another one, and it would all look funny. Once he was sent together with group of guys to scout the area deep in the Zone. When the group returned, Banana wasn't with them. They got in a shootout with monolithians, few of them died. And right in the middle of the fight - a blowout happened. They ran towards the house that was nearby, all survivors were able to hide there. All, but Banana. He almost made it, only few meters separated him from the safety. Zone always takes the best of us...

I heard a story about a stalker called Sevka. What's funny about it, he was using SEVA suit. He and his friend Leshka were young students. Sevka wanted to work for the ecologists to be in safety, but Leshka wanted to stay separate from any faction. After Brain Scorcher was turned off, few years passed and Leshka went on his journey to the centre of the Zone, while Sevka stayed. Few days passed and then Brain Scorcher starts working again out of nowhere. Sevka got worried about his friend, so he started preparing for trip to the North. I don't know how he managed to pull it off, but he arrived at Zaton in one piece. There he met his friend - standing with other zombified stalkers. Tragic end. Sevka grieved for long time, he thought it was his fault. He hid his zombified friend in the cave and tied so that he wouldn't escape. When Brain Scorcher was turned off again - he hit the road to find the Wish granter. He said he wanted to make a wish to make Leshka human again. He was very naive. Life is not a fairy tale, you can't bring back the dead...

I wonder, why do bandits like Vehicle station at the Cordon so much? They always camp there, even if you kick them out - they will return. And I would get it if they would have base in Dark Hollow, but they don't! A mystery...

Did you know that Duty once tried to kick bandits out of Dark Valley? They sent a group there, but they weren't successful - bandits fortified their base for good, all outside entrances were barricaded and they just shot at dutyers from the windows. Duty squad had to retreat with some losses. I don't know if they're planning on making another raid there or not - dutyers don't like to leave things unfinished.

In the past, tunnels at Yantar were snorks lair. There were a lot of them, ecologists couldn't leave the base safely. Lucky for them, dutyers came for the rescue and cleared the tunnels from the mutants. Now you can use those tunnels to hide from emissions.

Did you know that Farmstead at the Army Warehouses is used to close deals? Stalkers often use that spot for meetings because it's a quiet and convenient spot. Though one time bandits decided to camp there and rob those who were carrying any type of goods. Well, Barkeep hired some goons, they kicked bandits out of there. I don't know what exactly did they do to those thugs, but they have never returned to the spot.

Have you ever heard about major Khaletskiy? He was a tough soldier and a bastard. He hated stalker so much, he sold information about their travel routes to bandits. One time he sold two stalkers to slavery! Can you imagine? After he attacked Sidorovich's couriers and stole a case they had, stalkers got tired of it so they set up an ambush. When they caught him, they put him behind the bars in the Farm at the Cordon. They interrogated him again and again, where is the case - he never told them because he knew that his subordinates were going to free him. And he was right, military were planning a rescue operation, they even captured Vehicle station and set their base there. But stalkers hired an experienced mercenary to help them deal with the soldiers. After that Khaletskiy realised that no one will rescue him, so he gave up the coordinates of stash where he hid the case. Next day he disappeared. He killed two guards and ran. Everyone got suspicious of third guard and the mercenary - everyone knows mercs like to work for both sides to get paid more. Ever since, no one saw Khaletskiy again. But there were some weird soldiers that were wandering around Cordon - some people say those were Khaletskiy's agents, they were looking up for some information, maybe major wanted to take revenge...

I heard that one stalker tried to sneak inside the military roadblock at Cordon. He managed to get inside, go up to second floor and steal the PDA with information, but they caught him on his way back. When they interrogated him, he said that he was hired by a group of stalkers in Rookie village, he didn't know their names. Sidorovich had to pay a good price to stop military from raiding the village.

I heard that a group of stalkers appeared in Rookie village, no one knew anything about them. They sat there for few days, talked to few guys. Then someone tried to sneak inside the military roadblock but got caught, and the group of stalkers just vanished. It seems that they were looking for someone to do their job for them, but it didn't work out.

Have you ever heard of a stalker named Amit? I heard that he could get any information you want. One time he was getting information about some rifle upgrades for Aydar, the technician that was working in Agroprom some time ago. When he was carrying the information back to the technician, he climbed up a tower for some reason and died there, either from radiation or anomalies. It remains a mystery why did he climb there. Maybe he thought he saw something like artefact or a stash up there. Who knows...

There was a stalker called Losev. Don't ask me why was he called like that, I don't know. He was interested in Zone creatures, but no, he wasn't a hunter. He studied the behaviour of the mutants and wrote everything in his PDA. He had very good knowledge of any mutant kind, if you needed - he could tell you their weak points and habits. He had a theory that mutants are migrating from one corner of the Zone to other, just like normal animals. He recorded all cases of stalkers meeting with certain type of rare mutants. Once he noticed that mutants that he was tracking were vanishing somewhere between Great Swamps and Yantar. Then he decided to check Agroprom's Undergrounds to check if they had some sort of "transit point" there. He never returned. Later, when dutyers sent a mercenary down there to deal with some other mission, he found Losev's body and took his PDA. The PDA was full of migration maps of rare mutants - excluding north regions, of course. So even though Losev has died, his research was of great help for many stalkers.

I heard that few years ago there was a pac of pseudodogs at the Garbage. They attacked diggers at night, tearing poor guys apart. Yeah, many stalkers died then. Wild Napr, leader of diggers, got tired of it so he hired a mercenary to deal with the dogs. Next night, another group gets attacked by the mutants, but merc arrived in time to kill the dogs before anyone got seriously hurt. Nine dogs! Can you imagine? Yeah, I'm not looking forward to meeting with those puppies in the wild...

Did you know, that before Sidorovich, there was another trader sitting in that bunker? He was called Toad, and he was even worse than Sidorovich. He wasn't as fat, but his personality was ugly: he was rude to everyone, had no respect for stalkers. By the way, he only had one hand, and his legs were partly broken, making him unable to move very much. He always sat with a shotgun in his hand - maybe he felt at ease this way, or he just liked the gun. People say he used stalkers like expendable material, many rookies died because of him. He had a deal with military, just like Sidorovich does, so they weren't shooting at stalkers. But as the time went on, the relations between a group of stalkers and military worsened, a shootout happened. After that, military reinforced their posts and started to shoot those who came too close. Toad didn't appreciate that, it hurt his business, and the place weren't safe anymore, so he moved deeper into the Zone. But as far as I know, he died there. Maybe someone shot him, maybe he fell in anomaly. As I see it, Sidorovich realised that it was a good moment to make his own "trading empire", so he took Toad's place. He always knows how to make money.

Have you ever heard of a stalker called Journalist? People say he was some kind of reporter before he got into the Zone. And what was his business here is unknown. There were rumours that he was collecting information about the Zone - he wanted whole world to know about what's going on here. Some say he even worked with Strelok. And one day he just disappeared. No one knows what happened to him...

I heard about a stalker that was friends with zombies in Dead City. He fed them, they talked to him, well, at least they tried to. They told him about their lives before the Zone happened. People say that stalker was called Journalist. But I don't believe such stories. How can a zombie, whose brains became a mush, talk?

Ever heard of missing children in Pripyat? Some stalkers say that right before Second disaster happened, they were brought here. And those children never appeared again. Of course, most likely scenario is that they're... Well, you know. But there was one stalker that believed that those children are still here. No, not as zombies. That stalker, he was called Journalist, he believed that those children were hidden in the laboratories for experiments. Can you imagine? Experiments on children! I don't know if it's true or not, but that stalker suddenly vanished with no trace. If you think about it - maybe he dug too deep, and someone got rid of him... It's the Zone - everything might happen...

One stalker who once was in Dead City, told me a very creepy story. When he was walking trough the city with his partner, they saw a huge crowd of zombies. No, not the zombified stalker, the "citizen" zombies. One of them was mumbling something. So they killed everyone except that one. They approached him, their guns pointed at his head. The zombie mumbles: "He... good... Journa... list... won't huuurt us...". Stalkers got confused and shot him. Interesting, isn't it?

I heard that there was one mercenary, he was called Dog. He was very hard to kill. One time merc's base got swarmed by mutants, many people died. Dog survived. After some time, two stalkers attacked their base - Dog survived again. He was wounded, so he ran, and then emission happened. And even there he got lucky - he stumbled upon a blocked tunnel, where he hid. But then he ran out of luck - those two who attacked his base found him and finished him off. So yeah, luck won't always be on your side. So you better not rely on it too much.

I heard about a stalker that was called Saint. I don't know why did people call him like that, but he was old and kind, maybe that's why. Well, he became delirious one day - he was talking about reprogramming the psy-emitter to control the mutants. Stalkers tried to reason with him, but he didn't listen, and one day he wandered off in the direction of Red Forest. He never return. What age does to a man...

Did you know, that before, the old school building in Dead City was bandit's base? The leader of them was a local "authority" called Greyhound, not much is known about him. Well, they lived side by side with freedomers. Then, after one huge blowout, a psy-zone formed inside the school, and all the bandits turned into zombies. Imagine? You're just sitting in your base, chilling, when suddenly - BAM - you're a zombie. Damn...

Some mercs told me that they were spied on by some stalker in Dead City. They noticed him by accident, he was sitting in one of the broken buildings. They gave signal to the sniper - he shot the guy. When they searched his body, they found a PDA with ton of information about their movement around the city. That stalker, as they found out, was called Vasiliy, and he had a contract to spy on their base. Who hired him - is unknown. What known is, he was meant to mit with his nephew Victor in the Cordon to give him the information. How the story developed - can't tell, but something tells me that they at least tried to find that Victor guy. Maybe even found him.

I heard that there was a new guy in Rookie village, his name was Victor. His uncle called him in the Zone to give him something very important. Victor arrived at the meeting spot, but his uncle didn't. He wandered around, asked some people. THen he vanished - maybe he returned home, maybe the opposite - went deeper into the Zone. The thing is, a mercenary squad was noticed in Cordon at the same time, and when Victor disappeared - they disappeared too. Who knows, maybe they came after him.
I heard that Dushman, the leader of mercenaries, has a unique suit. It's a merc suit with fortified padding and improved gas mask. I wonder how much can a suit like that cost...

Have you ever heard about Jack Doublet? He was a fucking bastard. He was extorting money and other stuff like that. But the thing is, he only did that to the rookies, and since he looked like a tough and experienced stalker, they were afraid of confronting him. And one day Barkeep sent a stalker to get the documents from some abandoned building, and Jack decided to wait for stalker to leave the building and take the documents from him. But Jack overestimated his powers - stalker shot him as soon as Jack reached for the gun. Here's a lesson for ya: if you live like a dog - you die like a dog.

You know about the Arena near the bar, right? I heard that they kept a madman there, they used him as "final boss". He was called The Beast, and I must say, when he fought he always went all out, like an animal. Plus, he was wearing an exoskeleton, so beating him wasn't an easy task. It went on, until he shot off dutyer's arm and they decided to put an end to this. Arnie, of course, wasn't happy about it, but he understood that keeping this "warrior" is even more dangerous than keeping a mutant.

I heard about a stalker called Zob. He worked for ecologists as assistant, then after some incident he left them. Though it seems he did something that angered them, because they hired a stalker to kill him. So he didn't live for long after that.

I heard that Lukash had three bodyguards before - Kapets, Corner and Manovar. They all came to the Zone with him, and judging by what I've heard, all three - are fucking bastards. Kapets was wanted by Interpol for armed robberies, blackmail and rape. Rare scum. I don't know where are they now, but even other freedomers didn't like them - they tolerated them only because they were Lukash's old friends. Who knows what happened to them, maybe freedomers themselves dealt with them somewhere hidden from curious eyes.

Have you ever heard about captain Maximenko that was leading military in Agroprom before? I heard that he was very strict, he was sending failing soldiers to the catacombs. Although, under his command they were able to find documents about laboratory X-18, which means his methods were effective enough. But even if he was a good commander, he was a bad person. One soldier fixed an old Zaporozhets - Maximenko sent him to the catacombs and took the car for himself. Funny enough, it led to his death - he was riding around the institute and crashed into bulldozer.

I heard that there was a stalker that lived in the Agroprom, they called him Ratter. He wasn't called that for nothing - he worked in Kiev's zoo before, and in the Zone he started to train rats and breed them. Then he would sent them through the collector into Agroprom Undergrounds, where they would annoy the military. Well, people also say he was a bit crazy, like, he talked with the rats. Well, it's the Zone - there are all kinds of people here.

Did you know, that Liolik, Garry and Zhorik are brothers? They even wear the same clothes, although Liolik doesn't like his brothers, he almost hates them - won't even talk. It seems that's why he's working in the Arena instead of Bar.

You know that after Brain Scorcher was turned off, many stalkers moved North, right? Lesha Jaw was one of those guys, he was a stalker veteran. He led the group of seven people to the Radar. Lesha didn't like to take risks, so he sent two guys by the names of Crowbar and Log to approach Pripyat and scout the area. Time passed, they haven't returned. One of the group members, Treasurer, got tired of waiting so he fled. But the thing is, he carried the "gold reserve" of the group on his PDA. Lesha realised that it's not safe to move out yet, so he turned his group around and they left. Crowbar and Log were found dead near Pripyat later. And for the Treasurer - he was eaten by mutants not far away.

One stalker told me this story. When he was a rookie, he and his friend found a spot with a lot of artefacts at the Garbage - the railroad tunnel. They went there several times and kept the place secret. As time went on, they noticed that bandits were wandering around more often. Then one time they had to hide in the tunnel so that bandits wouldn't see them. Suddenly, an emission happened, and the tunnel got filled with anomalies - stalkers were trapped. His friend decided to go deeper into the tunnel in order to find another exit, but he tripped and fell into anomaly. Other stalker sat near the old train, unsure what to do. Some time passed and another stalker was passing by the tunnel, he noticed him and helped him get out. After that, he returned to the Cordon and never went deeper into the Zone.

Did you know, that the first military group that was sent to Agroprom Undegrounds never made it back to the surface? Leader of the group was commander Petrovich, a skilled soldier. I heard that he was constantly complaining about his service, but he always followed the orders and completed all missions assigned to him. This was the first and the last mission he couldn't complete - his whole group died, including him. When diggers found his PDA, it contained an audio recording with description of the operation. When soldiers were descending into the catacombs, they stumbled upon a few mutants living there. After dealing with them, they looked around for any documents, but were unsuccessful. They found nothing and tried to leave, but while they were underground - an emission occurred, and now the exit was blocked by anomaly. They tried looking for another exit, but instead they found a controller that killed them all.

I heard a story about stalker called Polkan. He was a military stalker before, he completed many missions in Zone's deeps. During one of his mission, his whole group was killed, but he managed to survive. He managed to get the evidence that htey were set up - they were sent on impossible mission intentionally. Polkan staged his death and joined loners to get his revenge by the "laws of the Zone". But he wasn't successful - military somehow realised that he survived and hired someone to finish him off. Sadly, the justice did not prevail.

Did you know that bandits had a base in Agroprom before? They were sitting in the building that is now occupied by the military. To be fair though, they didn't have time to make the place comfy - military arrived with a couple of BTRs. But bandits knew that they were coming - part of them fled to the Dark Valley, other part made a camp at the Garbage, near the broken crane. And those stupid guys who stayed at the base - got shot.

Some people say, that when mercenaries just arrived at their new base in Dead City, they got attacked by two stalkers. They killed half of mercs that were there from the distance, then stormed the building where survivors were hiding. Only 7 mercs were there when it happened, their squad was guarding the supplies. It seems that those two stalkers somehow knew when there will be least amount of people in the base, and then attacked. Some say that they were hired by someone to search for an artefact. What artefact - I don't know.

This story I heard from Barkeep. One day, dutyers found a crazy stalker near the Radar. They brought him to the base, examined him for injures and started the interrogation. He didn't say a word. No, it's not like he was stubborn or something. His brains resembled a mush at that point - he was mumbling something non-stop, didn't react to anything. Then he said a name: Hunchback. Barkeep remembered that three stalkers visited the bar few days ago - Hunchback, Baldy and someone third. And Baldy was enjoying his drink in the bar right at that moment. Well, dutyers approached him, asked about his friends. He played dumb at first, but then he confessed - he, together with his friend Hunchback and Pock were sent on a mission to the Radar by ecologists. They were ready to depart, but they didn't have the information about Brain Scorcher periods of decline. Pock somehow managed to get that information and they moved out. As they were walking through the Radar, suddenly Brain Scorcher started to work at full. Pock grabbed his head and fell off the slope. Baldy wanted to ran away, but Hunchback insisted on saving their friend. Together they climbed down the slope, when suddenly Brain Scorcher hit them again. Baldy came to his senses when he already was sitting at the military base. He didn't know what happened to his friends. Baldy refused to talk with Pock, he felt guilty for leaving them. Dutyers returned to Pock, one of them pretended to be Baldy - when suddenly Pock got mad and started to blame him for his treachery and escape. Dutyer pretended that he wanted to return to the Radar and find Hunchback. Pock told him that he won't be coming, but he gave dutyer the flash drive with information about Brain Scorcher periods of decline. Suddenly, Pock grabbed his gun and blew his brains out. No one was able to stop him. Barkeep was angry that he had to clean the place, but the information they got from Pock was very useful for Duty.

There was a stalker by the name of Sasha White. Ye, just like in the "Brigade". He was a stalker veteran and a master of explosives. For real, he had RPG-7y that he always carried on his back. He was one of the stalkers that were storming the Pripyat after Brain Scorcher was turned off. Sadly, their group was attacked by BTR, and Sasha died before he could fire his RPG. He was a good stalker...

I heard that before there was a maniacal sniper at the Garbage. He lived in the railway tunnel and left it during the day to shoot everything that moves. Stalkers had many problems because of him, but no one could shoot him down - he was a skilled veteran. Then stalkers got the idea to attack him at night - and they did so. But the sniper set up a wired trap at the entrance, and one of the stalkers blew himself up. Sniper woke up, a fight started, few more stalkers died, but they managed to kill the bastard.

I bet you heard how the military searched the X-18 lab, right? I heard that something went wrong during the search and the group didn't return. They sent another squad down there, and they found a crazy soldier that was wandering around the lab and shooting everything that moves. Well, of course, they had to shoot him. Judging by the things, that soldier went crazy either from fear, or because something got to his brains - then he shot his own group members. And... Don't ask me how do I know about it, okay? Let's say I got my own sources.

Did you know that stalker named Senior was leader of Freedom before Lukash? I don't know much about him, but it doesn't matter. After Senior died, there were two claimants for his place - Lukash and Murk. Murk was Senior's successor and no one even questioned that he will take his place. But everything went on differently as you might have guessed. Murk had to leave the base for personal reasons, and Lukash used it to his advantage. Having his buddies back him up, he took Senior's spot, and what's funny enough, no one said a word. When Murk returned, he was unpleasantly surprised by his new commander. But he had no grounds to take Lukash's place, so he had no choice but to accept his new leadership.

Did you know, that mercenaries once took Doctor hostage in Dead City? They made their way into the Foggy Swamps where Doctor used to live before and caught him at night. I don't know what did they want from the old man, but they carried him back to their base and put him behind the bars. I'm not sure how did Doctor manage to escape, I heard he used a moment when military attacked the mercs, but after that he settled somewhere at the Great Swamps.

I bet you've already heard about the legendary Cartographer. He is Forester's friend and he was making mappping the areas since first days of the Zone. But exploring Spatial anomalies always was his favourite hobby. He had strong intuition that helped him to exit them. I even heard that he had a hideout inside one of those anomalies.

Did you know, that legendary Cartographer has a hideout in one of the Spatial anomalies? I heard that you can't get there unless you have a special key. That key consists of several parts, and each part was hidden by Cartographer inside different factions territories, so that if they could use it only when they stop their meaningless war and unite for common purpose. What purpose is that - I don't know.

Have you ever heard about Cartographer? He's something like a legend. I heard that he avoids other stalkers by moving through Spatial anomalies. Even though he's old, he's very mobile. If someone would try to bother him for some nonsense - he would get very angry.

I bet you've heard about Black Digger, right? There are rumours that Fang, the member of Strelok's group, is the one who's responsible for his death. That Fang ordered some rare details from Black Digger, but he didn't like the price. Then he pretended to agree on the deal, and together they moved to Black Digger's hideout, then Fang killed him. After that he took the details he needed and ran off. How do I know all this? You see, when diggers noticed that Black Digger haven't been in a camp for a while, they scouted the area and finally found his secret hideout. There they found dead digger, and the hideout was a total mess, like if someone was searching for something. Then diggers asked stalkers about who they saw recently, and several stalkers said that they saw Fang in the camp. Then the rumours started, but no one was able to find Fang to confirm.
Are you sure?
Yes.
Wait here and guard this position.
I need you to follow me.
Avoid shooting at anyone for now.
Attack enemies only on sight.
Don't attack anyone unless they attack me first.
You got it.
Alright, girl.
Sure, what do you want me to do?
Thanks for the company. See you around.
Nevermind.
Quick! Find some cover!
I want you to patrol an area.
Start patrolling.
Stop patrolling.
Forget all your waypoints.
Add this spot to your current patrol.
Pick up any equipment you come across; it may be useful.
Scavenge bodies for anything useful.
Ignore any equipment you see laying around.
Ignore the dead.
Hey, let's explore as a team. We could help each other through the Zone.
Sure, sounds like a great idea! Lead the way.
Will you come with me to save your comrade?
Yes, he needs our help! Lead the way.
Sure, here's what I got.
Take a look.
Sure, let's trade.
Not really. Find someone else.
Sorry, I'd prefer to hang on to my stuff.
I'd rather not.
Piss off.
Do I look like a trader to you?
Get out of here, stalker.
I want to buy some equipment. %c[d_orange][Trade]
Sure thing.
Take a look.
Here's what I've got.
Sure, here's what I got.
Let me know if something catches your eye.
My equipment needs some tweaking. %c[d_orange][Repair/Upgrade]
I see, show me the equipment... And your money as well.
More crap to fix? Fine by me.
Great, more work.
I'll see if I can hammer it back into shape.
I want to buy medical supplies. %c[d_orange][Trade]
I'm low on supplies but here's what I have.
Damn, I'm gonna run out of this shit soon enough... Anyway, here.
Alright, don't waste the goods.
I don't have much, but here's what I can spare.
Hope you're not a junkie. Doesn't matter anyway, I suppose.
What you got to sell? %c[d_orange][Trade]
Food, drinks, a smoke... what do you want?
Feeling hungry, lass? Just check what I've got to sell.
What would you like to drink today? Vodka, or Putinka?
I found some old documents, are you interested?
Sure! Let's see what you got there.
Here, take a look.
Deal.
I think I will keep them for now...
Fine then.

I won't even ask where you got these from. Such documents are extraordinary. Almost everyone will benefit from them... including me. I'm ready to buy them right now for %s RU, plus a nice thing from my stock. What do you say?
Excellent! If you find something similar, bring it to me immediately. I will make sure that you get something nice in returns... Hehe.

What the... Alright, listen up. These documents are indeed worthy, they contain information about experiments involving the Zone. If I were you I would be careful about putting them in the wrong hands. Here's a deal, %s RU is a good price for such documents. I will get you covered with other stuff as well. I will arrange more money for any other documents you can bring. What do you think?
Great! You know where to find me when you get more of these.

Look at you, a little brave hero who came across these out of the sudden. I will be nice today and ignore these details. I know people who would kill for such documents, this is something that has been hidden for long fucking years you know. %s RU, and I advice you to think carefully.
Nice job boy, next time you "find" such a thing. Don't forget to give me a visit.
I guess these documents contain valuable information for our group. Unfortunately, things are not going so well currently, we have just gotten up on our feet. I can only offer you %s RU, forgive me.

Thank you! I understand that what I just gave you is not enough for such valuable information. I'll talk to our merchant, Dispute. Maybe he will save you some extra equipment the next time you bring more documents to us. When our situation improve, I can pay much more for such information, I promise!

Interesting... Let's proceed as follows... %s RU would be the correct price. Not to mention that "Duty" aren't at their best nowadays. Thanks to these documents, we will be able to arrange the deliveries of the equipment we need. I think that you will get something from this, too. Do you agree?

Today I will start negotiations with the military, I believe it won't take long enough to see some results. Next time you bring us such documents, I will pick up a more worthy reward for you. For now, take this, in gratitude from "Duty"!

Interesting... Very interesting. I'll ignore to the fact that you suddenly found such documents by yourself. Anyway, I have a better idea, or rather: a business proposal. So, you pass these documents to me and forget that you have ever seen them. If you find more, bring them over here, to me personally, without any middlemen, understand? I, on my part, can pay you in cash. %s RU for every document. So, are we agreed?
So, we agreed. For now, here is some money from my pocket, so as not to offend you at all.

Truly entertaining... Documents about experiments on the territory of the Zone... In times of breakthrough, some of our important clients would offer fabulous sums for them. Times are different now, and it's not that we need them especially in this poor state, but the information here is still of sufficient value, hmmm... Let's do it. I'll take them now for %s RU. Deal?
That's fine. If you find the same kind of documents you should bring them, don't be shy.

Very interesting stuff indeed! Such documents are not our specialty, but their contents can shed light on many of our studies. In addition, I have no doubts that our sponsors will be extremely interested in having them, which will have a very positive impact on our funding in returns. Do you want to conclude a special deal with us on this occasion? For documents like these, you can receive a monetary reward from us. I can arrange %s RU for the documents you just gave me.
Thank you! I am very pleased with our new cooperation.

Ha, where did you get these paper? You know, this kind of info can flip the world around upside down! I definitely won't hide it. If some illegal experiments happened in the past, people must know the truth. And "this" in your hands is just the start. I can offer you %s RU. And before you refuse, you should think of it this way: Today you are doing a good job, and tomorrow it will return to you in triple size.
Perfect! If you find something else that can help us with, I will be very grateful.
I need to manage the items you're carrying.
I need you to carry my loot
I need you to carry my loot.
Sure, tell me when you want your stuff back.
Eh, you're making me carry the heavy stuff, aren't you? Alright then.
Hold on man, I have stuff too! I can't carry all of your rubbish at once!
Sorry, but my backpack is full already.
What am I, a mule? Come on, man, my backpack is already bursting!
My turn to be the pack mule now. Can you pass the loot over?
Sure, here you go.
I'm looking for an escort squad, interested?

For an upfront payment I will protect you. I want %s for joining you for 24 hours, %s for 48 hours. Be warned that if you are travelling to some of those laboratories or Monolith controlled areas then you're on your own, got it?
Sorry, we have other jobs already.
24 hours is all that I need %c[d_orange][%s RU].
Okay, two days %c[d_orange][%s RU].
Actually... I changed my mind.
Let's move.
Let's move.
Alright then.
Alright.
The contract is over. You're on your own now, stay safe.
My service are fulfilled, I'm going back now. Take care.
That's not what we've agreed on. Sorry, I have no plans for suicide today. The deal is over.
Seriously?! What did I tell you when you accepted my assistance? I'm not going to these places, I'm outta here.
I need medical assistance.

I can treat all your injuries for 1,850 RU. I have a special serum that will put you back on your feet in no time. Unless you're irradiated - that, the serum cannot fix. Still, I could flush all that glowing shit out of you with another treatment for 1,480 RU. So, what have you decided?
Ah, of course, can't even keep yourself in one piece. Let's see...
Huh? Right, come on over.
Yeah, I'll fix you up... for a fee.
You don't have any wounds or show signs of radiation sickness. You should be good to go.
I'll take a look... Hmm... You look fine to me.
Hmm... Hands and feet are okay... head is in place... Yeah, you're alright.
Dude, you're healthier than a bloodsucker.
Don't be ridiculous. You're okay.
Heal my wounds. %c[d_orange][1,850 RU]
Get the radiation out of me. %c[d_orange][1,480 RU]
Fuck it, I need to be in a good shape. %c[d_orange][3,350 RU]
You know what, Doc? Fix yourself!
Here you go, stay safe next time.
Up to you.
I have an encrypted PDA, it doesn't seem to respond. Can you work it out for me?
If you're willing to show some cash, sure. 500 RU for every PDA I can unlock.
Fair enough, here.
Nevermind...
Here, you can use these now. Have fun.
Alright then.
You have connections right? Can you help me settle things with some people?
Maybe. Who did you piss off?
I want the Ukrainian troops around here to leave me in peace.

Hmmm. Tell you what. I can get one of their officers to forge temporary documentation for you. 5000 RU should be enough to grease a two day pass out of him. 10,000 RU for four days. They won't shoot you on sight while the pass is valid, but I'd advise not to push your luck with them regardless.
I want Sultan's men to stop harassing me.

Stop? They won't ever stop, but they might ignore you for a bit if you save them the trouble of having to fleece you. 5000 RU should satisfy them for two days, 10,000 RU for four. What's it going to be?
I made a bad impression with Clear Sky and wish to show I mean no harm.

I can't imagine what you did to piss some swamp-dwellers off. At any rate, 5000 RU should be enough to put them in a more forgiving mood for a day or two, while 10,000 RU should get them to relax a bit for four.
Duty is hounding me and I want them to stop.

For all their ideals of 'justice' and 'order', they're not above ignoring so-called 'anarchists and criminals' for a bit if you pay them off. 5000 RU should mollify them for two days, 10,000 RU for four.
There's a misunderstanding I'd like to clear with the Ecologists...and their guards.
Should be easy enough to convince the Scientists, sure. With 5,000 RU, you can work it out for a day or two. 10,000 RU for four days.
I pissed off Freedom.
Freedom? You goddamn fascist. Kidding, kidding. 5,000 RU should make them ignore you for a day or two, 10,000 RU for four days.
The Mercenaries. It's like I've got a price on my head.
You probably do. Luckily, they live for money. 5000 RU might buy them off for a day or two, 10,000 RU should pay them off for four.
Free Stalkers. I've somehow managed to get a bad rep with them.
Alright...wait, *all* of them? Wow, you really know how to make friends, don't you? I can convince them leave you alone for two days if you pay 5000 RU. For four days, 10,000 RU. Deal?
Here, two days should be enough.
Fine, make it four days.
I changed my mind.
Alright.
I will contact them to sort things out, so finish your business before they change their minds. And remember: keep your distance. If you got close enough, they will act.
I heard your message. Need a guide?
About the job...
Yes, are you willing to help?
What is it?
Give me some details.
Alright, let’s go.
Lead the way, stalker! When we get where I need to go, talk to me again and I'll give you your payment.
Sorry, but you don’t have the money to pay me in case the plan doesn’t go through.
I don’t even know who you are. No, thanks, stalker.
Remind me, where are we going?
Here we are.
Finally! Thanks, stalker, nice work. Here’s your money.
I’ve changed my mind. I’d prefer to cancel the job.
Really? Are you sure about that?
Yes, I’m sure.
Actually, never mind.
Looking for an experienced stalker who can lead me to %s. Right now, I’m %s. Name’s %s.
We’re too late. Sorry but this was not the deal, you won't get the full payment.
Here’s the deal: within %s hours, I need to be %s. I can pay you %s roubles for the job, but keep in mind that you won't get the full payment if we don’t get there in time.
I need to be
Then I’ll continue on my own, and I’ll be taking that money. What a shame.
Length, including starting point and destination:
A stalker needs to be
Great. Thanks for nothing.
What a shame.
Thanks for wasting my time.
%s, can you lend me some money?

You probably need the money for a good reason...but so do I. You’ll return fifty percent of the amount plus the amount itself, and keep in mind that my stuff won’t be available to you until you pay back your debt.
I just need %c[d_orange][5,000 RU].
Ok, give me %c[d_orange][10,000 RU].
I want %c[d_orange][15,000 RU].
Fine by me. I will take %c[d_orange][20,000 RU].
Never mind...
The only reason I'm allowing this is because I heard you were helpful. I hope you're trustworthy as well. Here you go. I want %c[d_orange][%s RU]%c[255,160,160,190] next time you show up here.
Alright.
Should I throw money around every time someone brings his sorry ass over here? The answer is no.
About the money I owe you...
Are you going to pay off your debt?
Sure, here's your money %c[d_orange][%s RU].
Um... I'm still working on it.
Great, your account is clean now.
You better hurry.
I don't think so. You owe me money, remember? You better pay your debt soon.
Got any special offers?
What’s on your mind?
I’d like to purchase some extra equipment.
That’s certainly possible, but nobody right now will want to sell you anything extra. You’ll have to gain some trust and experience, and after that you can buy equipment wholesale.
I’d like to purchase some extra equipment.
What are you interested in?
Medical supplies.
Provisions.
Ammunition.
Choose.
Choose.
Choose.
I’ve changed my mind.
%s %c[d_orange][%s RU]
I'd like to purchase info on hidden routes.

I do have some intel. \nEight thousand roubles is the regular price for most areas and locations, ten thousand for sensitive points and twelve thousand for info on hidden passages. \nIf you're interested, I can share some information on specific "secret" routes. Forty thousand roubles, no less.
That's a bit expensive for me.
Not my problem, come back when you're serious about it.
Here you go.
Routes Intelligence
Unknown path
CNPP South
CNPP North
Agroprom
Rostok
Dead City
Darkscape
Cordon
Garbage
Generators
Jupiter
Deserted Hospital
Limansk
Great Swamp
Army Warehouses
Outskirts
Meadow
Pripyat
Radar
Red Forest
Wild Territory
Truck Cemetery
Dark Valley
Yantar
Zaton
Lab X-8
Lab X-16
Lab X-18
Lab X-19
Clea Sky hidden path
Agroprom underground
Jupiter underground
Sarcophagus
Monolith Control Center
Monolith War Lab
I need to travel somewhere... Is this something that you can arrange for me?
Certainly. Where would you like to go?
Never mind.
Sounds great.
Actually, I need to go somewhere else...
That is too expensive.
That will cost you %s roubles.
The Skadovsk in Zaton.
Yanov station in Jupiter.
The science lab in Yantar.
The rookie village in the Cordon.
The Bar in Rostok.
The Freedom base at the army warehouses.
The mercenary base in the Dead City.
The military base in Agroprom.
The Clear Sky base in the Great Swamps.
Heard any news around here lately?
Like what?
What do you think about Nimble?
Nimble? I think that one of these days we'll jump that slippery jackass in a quiet place!
You hear anything about the Oasis?

Well, I heard a funny story once. Basically, the boys at Garbage started a rumour about where the Oasis is, and made it real believable, too. Then, they went to that location and waited. Well, what can I say? So many gullible losers showed up to share their stuff that the boys who started the whole thing left the Zone soon afterwards. And why not? Fellas were set for life. Only one of them stayed behind, some guy called Yoga...
That if you go there all your problems will be solved... I reckon that's gotta be handy - no more hangovers or haemorrhoids has gotta be good! Find it, set up a resort and let the cash pile up.

Why would I bother listening to that crap? All it is, is cheap talk for losers... Real men don't believe that shit. You know, you're sitting in a bar with a cold one in your hand and the stalkers are buzzing all around, arguing over where the Oasis is. And every one of those suckers swears he knows the location... Though for some reason it differs from sucker to sucker.
Ever meet a stalker called Magpie?

Sure have... One look at him told me he was a complete sucker and then I heard stalkers saying he's total scum, too. I don't know where he is though... You'll have to find him yourself if you're after him.
Nah... First time I've heard that name, buddy.
Do you know who could have stolen things from a personal box?
A rat. I reckon you'd better ask the bosses over at Yanov, 'cause they're known for hunting a rat down.
Who could help me with decrypting something here?
Well, I heard Nitro at Yanov is good. Apparently, back when he wasn't working for Duty the boys got him to crack stalker PDAs a couple of times... Ah, the good old days...

Don't get all scientific on me, chief. You're gonna need a hacker for that shit. Back when I was doing time I met one in the can but that's the only one I know. When I got out he still had about a fiver left...
I have the Duty trader's PDA. You know anyone who would be interested in it?
There's a trader at Skadovsk called Owl. He pays pretty good and the boys sell him stalker PDAs now and again. He doesn't ask too many questions either, so it's all good.

Just about anyone, buddy. Think about it: his own faction will bury the cocksucker alive, other factions will kick up a fuss, but Owl at Zaton would make that PDA disappear real good. Only thing is, only Owl knows where that PDA will turn up later on... It's up to you.
Where can I find tools around here?

Well, if you need surgical tools I'd look in hospitals and emergency stations. If you're looking for construction tools, then check by the quarry at Jupiter. If it's small tools you're after, then search old workshops.
How the hell should I know? I don't need tools to convince stalkers to cough up, just so you know... Relax, I'm just kidding.
Who can unblock a memory module?
Good question! I mean that's what I specialize in, right? Hah! Are you dumb, buddy? It's either gonna be technicians or scientists... You don't really think I deal with that kind of shit, do you?
I'll be honest with you: the last time I unblocked memory modules was back at school and the memory module was a friggin' floppy disk. Go talk to the experts and bust their balls about it.
Who could break into a steel container?

Know Cardan from Skadovsk? Well, he got wasted the other day and started chasing this asshole around the place with a jimmy. I reckon Cardan could use that jimmy for more useful purposes and crack stuff if you needed.
Well, with the right tools even I could do it, but then who drags equipment into the Zone with them? Visit the technicians, buddy - they're good at that kind of thing.
I'm looking for a stalker called Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
Who knows? Ask Sultan at Skadovsk. The boss usually knows where all the dupes are at.
Yeah, I've heard of that loser. He normally hangs around at Zaton, so you won't find him around here.
Do you know anything about the crashed helicopters?
Who might be interested in information about Duty's founder?
I don't know anyone who wouldn't be interested! That's explosive info, buddy, so your best bet is to go through Owl at Skadovsk - that way you'll get some cash but won't make any enemies.
No. Think about it, I've got Duty on the left, Freedom on the right and stalkers up my ass - and you expect me to keep my eyes on the sky?

Well, the boys said they spotted one swinging on the cables in Iron Forest, but you're gonna see a lot more than that out there... You're bound to run into an anomaly or get your skull crushed by a poltergeist.
Yeah, some fellas saw one crash onto a plateau but the thing is there's no way up there... they said it was flyin' so weird it looked like the pilot had popped a pill or something.
I heard a chopper went down, right into swamp water. It ran aground pretty quick and the water there is not exactly good for your health either - poison, chemicals and shit.
You saw any military around?
Who could be interested in maps of the area between Zaton and Jupiter?
Pilot, I reckon - he's the main guide around those parts. It would be good if he had some maps instead of using the stars like he's doing now...
The boys said that an army squad went down the southern plateau straight for the mercenary camp. They figured that the shit was about to kick off, so they left in a hurry.

I heard this story of how the army cockroaches were trying to get some shit out of their crashed chopper in the swamp. Imagine that, five army boys in uniform jumping around in a swamp trying not to get wet...

One fella told me how he was following a stalker to get a piece of his loot when he heard gunshots and shit. Turned out the army were fighting the mercs. He hid and waited the firefight out, but by that time the stalker had run off. Tough luck, huh?

Well, a bro told me about witnessing a pretty funny scene. Imagine that barge with a mill on top and Noah yapping away next to it, all fired up and shit, and ten army boys trying to get as far away from Noah's dog as possible. Well, my bro had himself a good laugh and left the circus to its own devices.
Nah, this is a pretty dodgy place, full of fellas with powered up shooters and shit... I ain't got the time to check which are military and which are Duty on a mission.
Do you know how to get to Pripyat?
Who could I hire to protect the scientists?

Hah, me and the boys will do the job! We'll give them protection like they ain't never seen! Stalkers and mutants will be shit scared to go anywhere near the friggin' place, trust me! Cough up the dough every week, and we're all yours. And don't forget a Christmas bonus!
By walking, buddy. Walk on over towards Jupiter and ask your questions there, 'cause there's no direct route from Zaton to Pripyat and that's a scientific fact.
Hey buddy, do I look like a guide or what? I mean, is there a tattoo on my forehead that says 'Ask stupid questions here' or something? Go ask Pilot, he's paid to answer questions about that shit.
No... What would I do there anyways? There ain't no stalkers to rip off there!
Can you suggest anyone that's not too tied down who'd be willing to make a move for Pripyat?

Pripyat ain't no place for guys like us. Think about it, it's full of mutants and anomalies... like the rest of the Zone... but without stalkers and their loot. When stalkers show up in Pripyat, give us a shout and we'll head on over there to maintain the natural order of things.
No idea, buddy. Sorry.
I found an unusual shooter. Do you know anyone who might know something about it?
Well, I'd ask the technicians. I mean, it's their business to know this shit, right?
Beats me, but stalkers from Skadovsk believe that Cardan is a technical genius or something. Talk to him if you want... He's just an old drunk if you ask me...
Who could I hire to take measurements for the scientists?

That's an easy one - our boys will do it. I mean they didn't go to school or anything, but they'll take whoever you want and measure them real good. Once they have the measurements, all they need is a nice grave and that's no problem either!
I found a very strange artefact. Can you suggest a buyer?

A strange artefact, you say? Let's have a look at it... Hand it over so I can see it better... Hah, relax buddy - I'm just kidding, but if I were you I'd keep that kind of thing out of sight. Others might not have such a good sense of humour.

You've got balls to be flashing that artefact around here. Respect. Here's the thing: the man to see for that shit is Beard over at Skadovsk. We don't know how he's getting the artefacts out of the Zone yet, so you should be able to sell yours no problem.
I found a whole bloodsucker lair nearby. What are we gonna do?
Err, what's there to do? Run the hell away, that's what!
Okay, forget about it.
Heard any news around here lately?
Like what?
What do you think about Nimble?
Nimble? Never heard of him. Maybe he's in another squad or something?
You hear anything about the Oasis?

It's a stalker fairytale. That's what stalkers do: make up shit that ain't true and then all get together and search for it! I'd ignore that stuff if I were you. It's like a gateway myth: believe it and you'll believe that the Wish Granter exists before long.

Ah, that place where wounds heal by themselves and your energy is magically replenished? I got news for you, friend: it doesn't exist. Stalkers invent that crap to make the Zone sound less dangerous than it is, but the harsh reality is that there are no safe places in the Zone. And you gotta keep a firm grasp on that reality out here, buddy - dreamer types don't last long in the Zone.

Yeah, and all the artefacts there are worth their weight in gold and are presented to you on a silver platter while you're getting your feet rubbed... I'm joking, of course. I doubt it exists, although it would be nice if it did. We could even set up a hospital there without the need for any medics - folks could just show up there and heal... Damn, what a pipe dream that is.
Ever meet a stalker called Magpie?
I struggle to remember all the people in Duty and you're asking me about stalkers? They have their base over at Skadovsk - go ask there.
No, I haven't.
Do you know who could have stolen things from a personal box?
Here we go! That would never happen at Duty's base but this place is full of those Freedom punks - that's where I'd look first.
Who could help me with decrypting something here?
There's a technician called Nitro over at Yanov station. He's pretty good with electronics. I once forgot the password to my PDA, and he cracked it in five seconds flat!
Yanov is where you need to go - look for Nitro, he's good at this stuff.
I have the Duty trader's PDA. You know anyone who would be interested in it?
A trader in Duty? That's impossible! Then again, if you have some information then you'd best hand it over to Lieutenant Colonel Shulga and let him deal with it.
Where can I find tools around here?
There's a whole plant nearby. Of course, it may have already been looted by now, but I'd still check the plant warehouses if I were you.
I'd start looking in the old workshops if I were you. You might also find something in stores.
There're only mutants and anomalies around here. Hah! I wouldn't look in anomalies, and burers and controllers won't help you with that either.
Actually, there's a train under the bridge around here. I've seen them before - they're usually used to transport technical personnel, so you might be able to find some tools in there.
Who can unblock a memory module?
Nitro - he's the only person at Yanov station who knows anything about that kind of thing.
You need to see a technician about that. The only decent technician around is Nitro at Yanov.
Who could break into a steel container?
They say there's a technician among the stalkers. He's a drunk, but he knows what he's doing. Talk to him.
Hah, you might as well carry a safe around with you. I'm sure Nitro won't be able to help you with that... if it had an electronic lock, it might be a different story...
I'm looking for a stalker called Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
You'd better ask the stalkers - they know their own. I've never heard of Snog or whatever his name is.
Do you know anything about the crashed helicopters?
Who might be interested in information about Duty's founder?
Our commander, of course. Report everything you know to Shulga and you'll get Duty's gratitude for sure.

Yeah, our scouts saw a military helicopter descend towards the reserve pads by Jupiter. They said they kept signalling them to change course but I guess the pilots had other things to worry about. I wonder if the army boys managed to get out of the mine field okay.
Not around here, no. Our presence here is limited... try asking our boys near Yanov.

Our patrol reported that a military helicopter attempted a crash landing near the Jupiter plant. Unfortunately, the chopper crashed right into the roof above the workshops. There are probably no survivors - the patrol didn't receive any distress signals after the crash.
You saw any military around?
Who could be interested in maps of the area between Zaton and Jupiter?
Someone who has some use for them. I'm talking about Pilot - he's a guide on the route between Yanov and Skadovsk, so he'd find those maps useful, that's for sure.
Military? I've not seen any around here, but we don't spend much time in this area.

A soldier's corpse was spotted in the mine field recently. He's probably one of the fellas that flew in in that chopper. The chopper carries up to eight people in addition to the crew, so they must have found a way out, though nobody knows where they went.
A military fella was seen at the scientists' bunker, and he only got there recently. I don't know the details.
Some guy in military uniform was seen entering a building by the Volkhov AA complex the other day. It's quite possible that it was just a zombie mistaken for a soldier though.

Stalkers spotted a military unit near Jupiter plant. Judging by the description it was special forces. They were accompanied by an unidentified stalker and headed towards Pripyat. This sounds reliable, but experience shows that information like that usually can't be trusted.
Do you know how to get to Pripyat?
Who could I hire to protect the scientists?
They won't find better protection than Duty will provide. Go see Lieutenant Colonel Shulga at Yanov - I'm sure the two of you will work something out.
Nah. While they've got Freedom people working for them, we'll stay well away from that place. Listening to those idiots crack their shitty jokes all day long is a fate worse than death.

Duty has no reason to look for a way to Pripyat at the moment, but we're collecting information anyway. There are unconfirmed reports that tunnels under the Jupiter plant lead to Pripyat. Checking this information would require searching everything in the plant area thoroughly.
No. If you need that kind of information you'll have to speak to a civilian guide - our scouts have enough on their plates as it is.
Our scouts regularly check the area for safe paths to Pripyat, but that hasn't yielded any results as yet.
Can you suggest anyone that's not too tied down who'd be willing to make a move for Pripyat?
Duty's presence in this area is limited. Speak to our people at Yanov.

There's a rumour that the scientists have a military guy in their bunker. He hasn't got much of a way out, though. You see, the scientists are there for twelve to eighteen months, and he's not going to get to the edge of the Zone on foot and on his own. Considering that, I bet he'd be interested.

I suggest you look among people who're after adventures. For example, there's a stalker called Vano over at Yanov station. He doesn't care what kind of shit he gets himself into, and he could be useful - that boy can find a way through an anomaly with his eyes closed.

Well, you could start a recruitment campaign in a mental hospital... Then again, I know a good alternative - Monolith fighters. Speaking of which, a squad of them was spotted near AA complex, and they probably even know the way to Pripyat, too... Hey man, I hope you're not taking me seriously...
Look for volunteers in Duty. Strider, for example. He hasn't got a mission yet, so I figure the Lieutenant Colonel might let him go with you.
Everyone knows that Duty's got the best fighters... but we've got other objectives at the moment.
I found an unusual shooter. Do you know anyone who might know something about it?
Well, I'll be! That's some cannon! Did you make it yourself or did you really find it? I've never seen anything like it... Ask the technicians.
Who could I hire to take measurements for the scientists?

That's a dumb question - Duty, of course. We've got lots of folks with experience, and we've worked with the scientists before. Go see Lieutenant Colonel Shulga - I'm sure he'll find a squad for the job.
Who'd want to work there if the bunker is protected by Freedom? Those friggin' pacifists are so stoned most of the time they're just as likely to shoot each other as the enemy.
I found a very strange artefact. Can you suggest a buyer?
Artefacts are all strange and I wouldn't advise carrying it on you either. Hand it over to the experts and be done with it.
You should show that thing to stalkers - they're experts in that kind of shit. Better still, show it to the person they sell their artefacts to.
I found a whole bloodsucker lair nearby. What are we gonna do?
Duty squads are not currently engaging in purging operations in this area, so the lair will have to wait.
Okay, forget about it.
Heard any news around here lately?
Like what?
What do you think about Nimble?
I've not heard much about him... You'd best ask the stalkers, he's one of them, ain't he?
You hear anything about the Oasis?

Loads... A nice story, I'll give you that. A palace in the sands, an island in the mist, a castle in the sky... Shangri La, Eden... the Oasis. Every free person has a dream and I don't blame 'em for it.

Well, I did hear an interesting story from this one stalker. I think he was the first person to mention the Oasis to me. He said that according to legend, all your wounds heal there and you become calm and relaxed, as if you're not in the Zone at all. I haven't seen him since... It was only after he left that I remembered that he used to walk with a limp, but when he left he walked straight and looked like he'd gotten a hell of a lot younger.

Yes, free stalkers gave me the coordinates... Ten different sets of coordinates. Putting them together gives us an area from the Scorcher to the CNPP with the Yanov bar somewhere near the centre. It's entirely possible that we're in the Oasis right now, so enjoy it!
Ever meet a stalker called Magpie?
Nah. I don't know many free stalkers around here.
Magpie? Nah, but that's a cool name.
Do you know who could have stolen things from a personal box?
